meta_description: Pérez Art Museum Miami is a modern and contemporary art museum dedicated to collecting and exhibiting international art of the 20th and 21st centuries.
hours_text:

**Miami, FL**

76°F, broken clouds

# Pérez Art Museum Miami

Open Today, 11:00 AM – 6:00 PM

## 

[]()

## _Thursdays at PAMM: Movement and Mindfulness with Kellie Williams_

Kick off your 2026 resolutions on Pérez Art Museum Miami’s (PAMM) waterfront terrace with a wellness series intended to help you start the New Year off right!

[Learn More ](https://www.pamm.org/en/events/event/thursdays-at-pamm-movement-and-mindfulness-with-kellie-williams/)

## _Mark Dion: The South Florida Wildlife Rescue Unit_

Final weeks to see the exhibition. On view through February 1.

[Learn More ](https://www.pamm.org/en/exhibition/language-and-image-conceptual-and-performance-based-photography-from-the-jorge-m-perez-collection/)

## _Miguel Braceli: Plaza Caracas on PAMMTV_

_Área_ by Miguel Braceli spotlights a large-scale participatory performance staged by Miguel Braceli in Plaza Caracas. In the heart of the Venezuelan city’s government district in 2014, Braceli created a common area through the collective action of 70 participants.

[Watch Now ](https://www.pamm.tv/film/miguel-braceli-area-2014/)

##  11:00 AM –  5:30 PM

**Galleries close at 5:30pm and entry will not be allowed after 6:00pm. P****lease arrive with enough time to view all exhibitions.**

**Please enjoy free admission as part of our Free Second Saturdays program!**

**At this time, tickets are made available two weeks in advance. If the date you plan on visiting is not available, please check back within two weeks of your visit.**

  * **Members** , please register or sign in at the top of the page to receive your discount and check out only with member price types below. Your username will be your current email used for member communications. Once completed, your ticket forms and event forms will be auto-populated upon sign-in for a faster checkout experience in the future. If you have trouble or have questions please send us an email to [members@pamm.org](mailto:%20members@pamm.org)
  * **Existing Student Pass holders** will need to register or sign in at the top of the page to redeem your Student Pass tickets. Please send us an email to [education@pamm.org](mailto:%20education@pamm.org) if you have questions.
  * If you have a **discount code** , please use at check out on the next page.

accessibility_text:
Search

**Miami, FL**

76°F, broken clouds

# Pérez Art Museum Miami

Open Today, 11:00 AM – 6:00 PM

#  Wifredo Lam  La ventana I (The Window)  1935 

  * [ African and African Diaspora ](
							https://www.pamm.org/en/collection/?art_class=african-and-african-diaspora							)

  * [ Caribbean and Caribbean Diaspora ](
							https://www.pamm.org/en/collection/?art_class=caribbean-and-caribbean-diaspora							)

  * [ Latin American and Latinx ](
							https://www.pamm.org/en/collection/?art_class=latin-american-and-latinx							)

© 2022 Artists Rights Society (ARS), New York / ADAGP, Paris

Wifredo Lam is one of the most renowned artists of the vanguard movement that emerged in Cuba during the 1920s. Like many of their Latin American contemporaries, the first generation of Cuban modernists moved, to Europe – Spain and France in particular, to immerse themselves in the new formal and conceptual styles of the time. Lam painted La Ventana, I, in Spain soon after the artist lost his first wife and child to tuberculosis. During a period marked by illness, depression and a search for his own identity as an artist, Lam produced several renditions of this scene over a period of a year, varying only in perspective and color. Stylistically, the work reflects the early influence of Matisse: the simple dark lines and contours that outline the cathedral structure and urban buildings rendered in the background; the flat planes, simplification of forms and off-centered perspective are ...
